channel.title: Tim Videos Planet - Developers news - Category: GSOC-2014 / Tag: RUBY
channel.description: News from our best developers, all news aggregated by planet.

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 04/07/2014
item.description:
Today I talked with Tim about deployment of getting-started page, we've created document with steps of deployment and we will continue tomorrow.

I also found some great posts about organizing work with GitHub Issues: http://www.ianbicking.org/blog/2014/03/use-github-issues-to-organize-a-project.html and http://wiredcraft.com/posts/2014/01/08/how-we-write-our-github-issues.html. Great post how to keep well organization of projects and issues and make sure that every feature is created incremental.

I also found great application to manage Issues and assignment and status (to make Issues more like Trello or Kanban table): https://waffle.io/ and http://octokan.com, I've tested them, and I very like waffle.io, because of nice and easy interface, it can be used by everyone in organization to track progress of projects and it is free of charge!

[code] added labels to issues website on Planet
[code] added issue content to issues website on Planet (currently they are not generated from markdown, I will fix it tomorrow)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/supybot-configuration
[GSoC Snippet] 02/07/2014 and 03/07/2014
item.description:
Last few days I've had some problems with Internet connection, because I am currently in Croatia for 2 weeks. But finally I bought safe and quite fast Internet here and started to work again. Because I had poor Internet connection I wasn't able even to commit and connect to SSH (because of timeout error), but now it seems to work good.

[code] I've started working on issues, did some research and read about it, and created new page on planet with issues to start working on it (currently it has contains only list with issues, but soon I will add more features to that).

[code] I've created new configuration for supybot to notificate new planet news on IRC. I think all is ready to be deployed on our server, but I need to talk with Tim how to add that supybot to server (run manually or with crontab, or as a deamon, to make sure that will always work).

Next days I will spend working on issues, adding new functionalities, etc.
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at pinoss/supybot-configuration
pinoss created repository pinoss/supybot-configuration
pinoss created branch master at pinoss/supybot-configuration
[GSoC Snippet] 29/06/2014
item.description:
[configuration] finally I figured out how Supybot should be configured and I have basic configuration (https://github.com/pinoss/supybot-configuration). Supybot checks for changes in RSS for every 15 minutes and sends a message to irc channel. I've used and tested it on my test chanel on freenode, tomorrow I will add that bot to our server to run on actually used channel.

Finally I've passed all my exams and now I will have more time for work. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 27/08/2014
item.description:
[configuration] supybot configuration to add RSS feed to our IRC: Today I was fighting (for few hours) with Supybot configuration. Actually, thanks to supybot-wizard, configuration is really easy, but in documentation there are no examples of correct configuration and some custom options are really hard to be set. So I still don't have working configuration, but I think I am will do that tomorrow. :+1:
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC] What happenned during this week? (week 5)
item.description:
It was a great month, I learned a lot about Jekyll and Ruby, wrote a lot of new plugins, contributed to planet.rb and my first GitHub pull request. A lot of great work was made thanks to GSoC and TimVideos organization, thank you guys. :) I am really satisfied about my work during this month and can't wait to see results of my work in next 2 months.

During this week I spend a lot of time on integrating planet.timvideos.us with GitHub API to get a lot of information from GitHub repositories and integrating edit interface (prose.io) to work with our getting-started page.

On edit interface I've added prose.io realistic preview to every edit, so you will see your changes with realistic preview, I've also added edit button to every editable part of website to make editing easier.

I've created GitHub Statistic page on planet (http://planet.timvideos.us/stats/), I've added there 5 charts per project and worked on presenting data to the user, I still have to fix some small issues with charts but almost all is done with that part.

I've also created People page on planet (http://planet.timvideos.us/people/) with information about people related to TimVideos community, and almost all data is fetched from GitHub page (avatar, blog url, name, location, etc.), but you can also override that information if you want to customize it a little bit.

I've also made some small changes, like moving from prose.io application into gh-pages branch of my prose fork.

Now I will work at IRC notifications about updates and start working on page with issues, but I also need to learn to last exams in that semester. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 25/06/2014
item.description:
[university] Still need some time to learn to exams and I spend most of day reading books.
[code] Created commit activity chart (with additions, deletions), Resolved problems with formatting axis X, but still I spend a lot of time to searching best solution and I did not found it yet.


Tomorrow I will write a week summary post and small summary about my adventure with GSoC because of mid-term evaluation. :)
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: [GSoC Snippet] 24/06/2014
item.description:
[university] Today I've had one of last exams, so I was at university and passing exam and at home I spend some time learning to other exams.
[code] Created code frequency chart (with additions, deletions), I have small problem with formatting axis x (that's axis with Dates, but Highcharts are trying to display all Dates instead of groupings

Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: pinoss pushed to master at timvideos/planet
[GSoC Snippet] 22/06/2014
item.description:
[research] research about javascript chart library (finally I've chosen Highchart)
[research/design] research about charts types and statistics available from GitHub (currently I am thinking about 3-4 charts: contributors activity (pie chart), commit timeline chart (area/line chart), code frequency chart (area/line chart), commits per weekday chart (pie chart)
[code] add first chart to planet.timvideos.us, pie chart with contributors activity in project, I've added 5 TimVideos projects to display that feature

Plans for next days:
[code] add another charts to planet
[code] add information on IRC if new posts has been added to planet (I am thinking about writing a listener on RSS feed from planet.timvideos.us and do action if something has changed, and I will set IRC notifications and social media notifications)
[management] move from Producteev to GitHub Issues and create new Issues with subtasks

This week I will have last exams, so I might not always be on IRC, but I will work hard to pass all exams and get all planned things done. :+1:
Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer
